_description: A Lament of the Virgin Mary — fourteen 8-line stanzas (ababcdcd)

CULFf238.First Lines:
Lystenyþ lordynges to my taleAnd ye schall here of oon
                    story…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…Out of þys worlde when we ar broȝtWith hym &
                    hur in heuyn to rest Amen
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
CULFf238.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas. 
             The Chester Plays.
         2 vols. London: Shakespeare Society, 1843, 1847: 2.204-7.

CULFf548.First Lines:
Listyns lordyngus to my taleAnd ȝe shall here of an
                    story…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…Owt of this worde when we are broȝtWith hym and hir in
                    heuyn to rest Explicit
CULFf548.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 18-22.
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 196.

BLHar5396.First Lines: Lestyns lordyngys to my taleAnd ȝe schal here of on story…
BLHar5396.Last Lines: …Out of þys worlde whan we are broȝtWyth hur & hym in heuyn to rest
BLHar5396.Attributed Title: Our Ladys Song Of the Chyld þat soked hyr brest (added by a later hand to upper margin, f. 283)
